snippet.textDisplay:
People from other countries: "OMG! My cousins cousin has the Coronavirus! How are we going to survive this!?"


Me: "Bye, mom! I'm going to my friend's house for the weekend! Just gonna run by the store to get some snacks!"


Live your normal life. Don't let a decease come in the way of that. Just remember to have a better hygiene than usual, take showers more regularly, wash you hands properly, if you fell sick in any way just call in sick for work and keep a little larger distance between you and other people.

snippet.textDisplay:
The death toll of corona virus, world wide, has now topped 5000 victims. So out of a population of 7,530,000,000, that means you have a 1-in-1,506,000 chance of dying from covid-19. To put it in perspective, you have a 1-in-700,000 chance of being struck by lightning. Yeah, that's right, odds are that you will die from lightning before the corona virus has a chance to get you.

Unless you are well over 60 and in less than good health, OR you have a pre-existing heart/lung disease or a problem with your immune system, you have nothing to fear. These "experts" made the same dire predictions back in the early 2000s with both the swine flu and then the bird flu, neither of which ended up being anywhere near as bad as they claimed. This is an excuse for politicians to make you afraid in order to get votes and of the wealthy to manipulate the stock market in their favor. Despite what chicken-liberal claims, the sky is not falling.

Anyone notice that every one of these "world threatening virii" - bird flu, swine flu, corona, etc. all originate in China? Shouldn't that be raising some serious red flags as to whether ANYONE should be allowing open travel to and from China? Either they are the most unhygienic shithole on the planet, or they are purposefully manufacturing these diseases. Either possibility should give you pause to think.
snippet.textOriginal:
The death toll of corona virus, world wide, has now topped 5000 victims. So out of a population of 7,530,000,000, that means you have a 1-in-1,506,000 chance of dying from covid-19. To put it in perspective, you have a 1-in-700,000 chance of being struck by lightning.  Yeah, that's right, odds are that you will die from lightning before the corona virus has a chance to get you.

Unless you are well over 60 and in less than good health, OR you have a pre-existing heart/lung disease or a problem with your immune system, you have nothing to fear.  These "experts" made the same dire predictions back in the early 2000s with both the swine flu and then the bird flu, neither of which ended up being anywhere near as bad as they claimed. This is an excuse for politicians to make you afraid in order to get votes and of the wealthy to manipulate the stock market in their favor. Despite what chicken-liberal claims, the sky is not falling.

Anyone notice that every one of these "world threatening virii" - bird flu, swine flu, corona, etc.  all originate in China?  Shouldn't that be raising some serious red flags as to whether ANYONE should be allowing open travel to and from China?  Either they are the most unhygienic shithole on the planet, or they are purposefully manufacturing these diseases.  Either possibility should give you pause to think.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with these guys.  Does anybody remember "SARS", that viral pandemic that appeared out of South China about 20 years ago?  Does anybody remember "Swine Flu"?  Does anybody remember the Ebola pandemic that everybody was so worried about only a couple of years ago?  All of those crises came and went.  I'm not saying that Corona Virus isn't serious, or that people should not take precautions, but it isn't the end of the world and, as the saying goes "this, too, shall pass away".  Give the doctors and scientists a chance to get a handle on this problem.
snippet.textOriginal: I agree with these guys.  Does anybody remember "SARS", that viral pandemic that appeared out of South China about 20 years ago?  Does anybody remember "Swine Flu"? snippet.textDisplay: When Ebola broke out, we were in different leadership. We had a functioning CDC and global partnership with the world. The reason why people are panicking is because we don’t have that. We cannot get the country tested while other countries have. The coronavirus has been warned about 3 months ago. Yet we don’t know what to do. We’re not taking in how other countries are dealing with it because Americans are like millennials who then they know all the answers and refuse to listen to older more established countries because we’ve been told too often were the best while completely disregarding older statesmen. It’s why people say “yeah boomer” like it’s an insult. But guess what? Other countries have people who have recovered when we still have not tested nearly enough people. We’re basically reacting like third world nations because the leadership is either in denial or thinking we can pray it away.

snippet.textDisplay:
Sorry, but what a asshole!
Is he stupid or ignorant or both??
He left out a lot important things!
Even if covid-19 itself is not that dangerous for the most people, but it can cause a lot of problems which will effect a lot of people!
Look at Italy for example!
I am next to Italy in Austria, people are preparing for a lock down so that we, hopefully, don't have to face a medical collapse like in Italy.
But we have healthcare and sick leave (and not only 5 days a year, what the fuck?!) and we don't have to worry about that.
This makes me really angry.
I wish all americans good luck, I think you will need lots of luck...

snippet.textDisplay: I loved the last statement in this clip from Bill Di Blasio:  You gotta tell people the truth, and then invite them to be part of the solution."  I believe that is what is wanted and needed at this time - and always - from our leaders.  Because COVID-10 is so contagious, even if we all hid ourselves away for a while, it seems eventually we would be all be exposed and likely become infected.  IMO, the main reason for trying not to all catch it at the same time is to allow much needed time for treatments, preventions, and cures to be identified, tested, and produced, albeit as quickly as possible.  It is also possible people can re-acquire this disease and/or its various evolving strains, which also needs to be better understood.  At the same time we also need to be mindful of protecting our most vulnerable citizens, especially the elderly and immune-compromised, and keeping our "society" and "economy" going as as best as possible so we can all survive and emerge better prepared for the next time something like this happens.  There are a lot of time-sensitive factors at play so TELLING THE TRUTH IS EXTREMELY IMPORTANT!!!

snippet.textDisplay: Bill de Blasio is so proud when he says NY has five days paid sick leave. Let that sink in. Meaning other cities do not. And just five days? You're only allowed to be sick five days? Most people can't afford to be sick just 5 days out of the year and will work and infect others. Jeez, countries in Europe, heck in Asia and Africa can get from 30 to 60 paid sick leave a year (government mandated) salary subject to deduction etc. America - land of the "free" and no real healthcare. America is truly lost if Bernie Sanders (a centrist by European standards) is not elected.

snippet.textDisplay:
Jesus I'm glad living in Germany right now. I mean the virus has spread across our country and there are cases close nearby my town. I do not wanna brag but it really surprised me to find out that Americans have to go to work in order to get 100% of their income. We here have 6 weeks where we can be sick without worrying about our income. After that we get "only" 80% back for (I think) 2 years.

I hope America will changes this. I mean if people are to sick to work and have to play it down in order to support their families is not the right way.

Anyway stay save across the pond! Let's hope for the best.
snippet.textOriginal:

We here have 6 weeks where we can be sick without worrying about our income. After that we get "only" 80% back for (I think) 2 years. 

I hope America will changes this. I mean if people are to sick to work and have to play it down in order to support their families is not the right way. 

Anyway stay save across the pond! Let's hope for the best.

snippet.textDisplay: People are dying every year from seasonal flu. Some winters are mild, some are hard and 10s of thousands die, nobody cares. Now a virus comes, not so different from the flu, probably double to triple the mortality, and people freak out. De Blasio is actually right, it has to get balanced! What is saving someones live, if anothers is completely destroyed bc they can't pay shit. If you are worried about you or your kid spreading it to the elderly or preconditioned, then y the fuck you don't cut the contact for some weeks?! Put the people at risk in quarantine, not everybody else! Countries like ukraine and italy will feel the aftermath quite hard from shutting everything down for weeks! I'm thankful as german that my government stays as cool headed as de blasio. And sure hope it stays this way

snippet.textDisplay: Trump called it "Foreign virus". Let's not be fooled.  US CDC director Redfield on March 11 admitted that "some Americans who were said to have died from influenza may have actually died from the COVID-19", which means the virus could really have originated in US and been brought to China by the US military players attending the game in Wuhan.  Wuhan med authority indeed recorded that they have treated several "imported unknown pneumonia" cases.  Trump owes us a thorough tracking and posthumous testing of more of the late "flu "victums' bodies, to determine exactly when did the coronavirus start to kill people in US. We need the truth, we can battle a virus but don't want sacrifice our loved ones lives for US political gains.✊
snippet.textOriginal: Trump called it "Foreign virus". Let's not be fooled. snippet.textDisplay:
I am a Student in china as much as i agree with New York's City Mayor, i believe a lot of action is required to Handle this situation.
Here is why Even though China is the first Country to have Virus it Will be the First to Survive this.
1. China being the country it is and having the type of Government it has , means everyone in china will march or talk likewise , Chinese are trained from childhood to stand in line so if they say put on a mask they mean it , no one is above the government.
2.Countries around the world seem to be waiting for a large scale outbreak to take action, it takes a lot of man power to handle this , that is why as soon as the virus was found, they went ahead and took a lot of health measures (Wuhan Lock down , Schools lock down, online lectures , online purchasing, medical health gear dispatch, online medical accounts for each person using facilities outside their house ) the list could go on.
3.Even though china has the highest death counts , they will never panic maybe if they weren't any measures taken, but as the situation gets worse Thousands of people in china have recovered having gone through heavy intense observation and medical care .
More Measures Taken
-Cant use public transport without a mask.
-Limited number of people allowed to go out for shopping whatsoever (if you live in a highly secured area or urban area).
-Most Restaurants/Takeaway have been closed.
a lot more ..(tired of typing)

This VIRUS will disappear in time yes , but there's no sweet without sweat a lot needs to be done .

snippet.textDisplay:
I understand he's trying not to have people panic, but this kind of misinformation can be very dangerous. Italian here, living through a crisis and living through a lockdown cause our government cares more about us and our health than the economy.

You close schools cause while kids do not get, in most cases, SERIOUSLY affected by the virus, they're the biggest spreaders. That means they come back home and infect their parents and their grandparents, the people more at risk of serious complications. In Italy we get paid sick leave and paid parental leave to deal with children at home, especially in this time of crisis.
Yes, we shut down all our stores but supermarkets and pharmacies. Our government has set aside 25billion € to aid the people, and suspended taxes and mortgages.
It's gonna be tough for a few weeks and for sure our economy will suffer. But what's more important? People's health or the economy?

We have one of the best healthcare systems in the world and our HC is free. We've tested like crazy since the beginning of the outbreak and our hospitals are doing their best to help everyone. The problem is, we're struggling due to the shear amount of people needing ICU. Too many people needing help. 5k people are hospitalized only in Lombardy. Just one hospital in the city of Piacenza is admitting 40 new patients with coronavirus pneumonia everyday. 40 new patients EVERYDAY.

You take proactive and draconian steps so you can try to avoid the virus spreading to a point where it overwhelms your system. Cause no matter how good your system is, if it's overwhelmed you won't be able to help everyone.
And our system is great. How is yours?

Stay safe, americans. Take matters in your own hands, since it's clear your politicians don't care about you. Stay home. Avoid crowded places. Avoid public transportation, take the bike if you don't have a car. Work from home if you can. Stocking up in goods is smart but it's entirely counterproductive if to do so you're spending time on top of each other in a very crowded supermarket. Keep a distance from people. Don't go out with your friends. Everyone could potentially be infected cause NOT EVERYONE SHOWS SYMPTOMS BUT THEY CAN SPREAD IT ANYWAY.
Also, yes, the numbers of older people in critical conditions is higher, but we have 18yo and younger people in ICU too. Just because the number is lower doesn't mean that younger people are safe. BE SMART and be responsible.
This is serious. Stay safe.

snippet.textDisplay: This grated on me "it would be devastating for the United States and it would be devastating for   NYC" Something to keep in mind regarding these major nations 'shutting down' during C19: preventative measures to avoid crashing the medical system.   The current quarantine measures in Italy aren't meant to eradicate the disease from the country by the end of April! They're put in place to SLOW the outbreak so medical institutions and staff aren't totally overwhelmed [and then collapse] with millions of people in the hospital. The US is a large country with a vast population. If it sees the arc of contagion seen in the world so far, and given the level of preparation, population and 'effed medical system, it's going to be ugly (and far more expensive than a temporary shut down).  Stay home people.  Your holiday, night out, sporting event, hot yoga class isn't worth your health or the possibility of you infecting others, which leads me to our children - thankfully, they seem to be resistant to C19, but schools should be closed because they are vectors for transmission to those of the popular who are vulnerable to the disease.
